Key Match Events: India's last Group 'A' match against Canada was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to a wet outfield.
India finished on top of the group with 7 points and will face Afghanistan in its first Super 8 fixture at Barbados on June 20.
Canada, with 3 points, exited the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada head coach Pubudu Dassanayake expressed disappointment over not being able to play against India but appreciated the opportunity to interact with the Indian team.
India batting coach Vikram Rathour stated that it was disappointing for fans and the team to not get a game, but acknowledged the uncontrollable nature of rain.
Rathour also mentioned concerns about sustaining injuries on a wet outfield and the importance of avoiding injuries ahead of important matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was called off by umpires Richard Kettleborough and Sharfuddoula after inspecting the outfield.
There was no rain on match day, but a heavy downpour on the previous night caused the outfield to be unplayable.
The Indian team will now focus on different conditions in the West Indies, where pitches will not heavily assist pacers.
